justification: “Participants performed the Horizon Task (Wilson et al., 2014) to measure explore-exploit behavior.”

measured_by: change in p(high info) between horizon 1 and horizon 6 on the Horizon Task
justification: “We define directed exploration as the change in (high info) between horizon 1 and horizon 6.”

measured_by: change in p(low mean) between horizon 1 and horizon 6 on the Horizon Task
justification: “We define random exploration as the change in (low mean) between horizon 1 and horizon 6.”

measured_by: p(high info) in horizon 1 on the Horizon Task
justification: “We define the baseline uncertainty attitude as (high info) in horizon 1.”

measured_by: p(low mean) in horizon 1 on the Horizon Task
justification: “We define… baseline behavioral variability as (low mean) in horizon 1.”
“Out of the 74 older adults who took part in the experiment, 55 met our criterion through neuropsychological testing (a score of 26 or higher on the MoCA).”
“Processing Speed: This factor consisted of scores Coding and Symbol Search.”

measured_by: Digit Span Forward & Backward / WAIS Letter-Number Sequencing
justification: “Working Memory: This factor consisted of Digit Span Forwards & Backwards as well as Letter-Number Sequencing scores.”

measured_by: Craft Story Delayed Recall / Benson Figure Delayed Recall / Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (AVLT) Delayed Recall
justification: “Episodic Memory: This factor consisted of Craft Story Delayed Recall, Benson Figure Delayed Recall, and AVLT Delayed recall scores.”

measured_by: WAIS Vocabulary / North American Adult Reading Test (NAART)
justification: “Crystallized Intelligence: This factor consisted of WAIS Vocabulary and the National Adult Reading Test (NAART).”

measured_by: Trail Making Test B / Stroop Color-Word Interference / WAIS Block Design
justification: “Executive Function: This factor consisted of Trail Making B, Stroop Color-Word Interference, and Block Design scores.”
